subject: RE: [junit] Junit - RMI Interaction (Part II)
msgSnippet: Try turning off Reload altogether.  This should be the effect of the textui within the GUI.  If that works put your class package name (can you use the fully
messageBody:
Try turning off Reload altogether. This should be the effect of the
textui within the GUI. If that works put your class' package name (can
you use the fully qualified class name here?) in the
excluded.properties.

=jason
[:question | ^One]

Subject: [junit] Junit - RMI Interaction (Part II)


I have found that I am able to use Textui ok, it is just Swingui that
interacts with RMI.

I suspect that I should somehow change the file excluded.properties
in junit.jar (like I had to for using Junit with Log4J) but I don't
know what to edit it to!!!
